SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.network

Class ServerImpl

java.lang.Object
java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
it.polimi.ingsw.network.ServerImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
BoardListener, BookshelfListener, GameListener, ModelListener, PlayerListener, Server, Serializable, Remote
public class ServerImpl extends UnicastRemoteObject implements Server, ModelListener
This class indicates the server's implementation. It is an extension of the UnicastRemoteObject and also a ModelListener's implementation. It contains methods that implements all the server's functionalities described in the server's interface class.
See Also:
  • Server
  • ModelListener
  • UnicastRemoteObject
  • Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • ServerImpl

      public ServerImpl() throws RemoteException
      Class constructor. initialize the server's attributes to their default values, also instantiating a new game controller. Finally, the server registers itself as a listener on the game and the board classes to identify changes.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a connection error occurs
      See Also:
      • GameController
      • Game
      • Board

    • ServerImpl

      public ServerImpl(int port) throws RemoteException
      Class constructor. initialize the server's port to the given value. Starts the thread's pinging.
      Parameters:
      port - the server's port number.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a connection error occurs

    • ServerImpl

      public ServerImpl(int port, RMIClientSocketFactory csf, RMIServerSocketFactory ssf) throws RemoteException
      Class constructor. initialize the server's ip and port to the given values. Starts the thread's pinging.
      Parameters:
      port - the server's port number.
      csf - the client socket factory employed for the RMI.
      ssf - the server socket factory employed for the RMI.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a connection error occurs
      See Also:
      • Server
      • RMIClientSocketFactory
      • RMIServerSocketFactory

    • gameStateChanged

      public void gameStateChanged()
      Indicates a change in the current game's state. It is also used to register every player and his bookshelf as a listener on the server implementation if the game just entered in the ON_GOING state. Finally, if the Game is in RESET_NEEDED state just call resetServer() method.
      Specified by:
      gameStateChanged in interface GameListener
      See Also:
      • Game
      • Player
      • WebSocket.Listener

    • chatUpdated

      Used for game's chat updating management. In case of a communication error prints a control message to signal it.

    • playerHasReconnected

      public void playerHasReconnected()
